/DEV8008/AWGS/0/ELF/DATA.Description: Contains the data of the uploaded ELF file.

/DEV8008/TRIGGERS/IN/2/IMP50.Description: Trigger input impedance: When on, the trigger input impedance is 50 Ohm, when off 1 k Ohm.

/DEV8008/AWGS/2/SWEEP/AWGTRIGS/3.Description: Node used by the sweeper module for fast index sweeps. When selected as sweep grid the sweeper module will switch into a fast index based scan mode. This mode can be up to 1000 times faster than conventional node sweeps. The sequencer program must support this functionality. See section 'AWG Index Sweep' of the UHF user manual for more information.

/DEV8008/STATS/CMDSTREAM/BANDWIDTH.Description: Command streaming bandwidth usage on the physical network connection between device and data server.

/DEV8008/SIGOUTS/5/AMPLITUDES/0.Description: Sets the peak amplitude that the oscillator assigned to the given demodulation channel contributes to the signal output.

/DEV8008/AWGS/0/USERREGS/11.Description: Integer user register value. The sequencer has reading and writing access to the user register values during run time.

/DEV8008/SYSTEM/ACTIVEINTERFACE.Description: Currently active interface of the device.

/DEV8008/SIGOUTS/6/ENABLES/0.Description: Enables individual output signal amplitude. When the MD option is used, it is possible to generate signals being the linear combination of the available demodulator frequencies.

/DEV8008/AWGS/2/OUTPUTS/0/ENABLES/0.Description: Enables the driving of the given AWG output channel.

/DEV8008/STATUS/FLAGS/PACKETLOSSTCP.Description: Flag indicating if tcp packages have been lost.

/DEV8008/SIGOUTS/0/ON.Description: Enabling/Disabling the Signal Output. Corresponds to the blue LED indicator on the instrument front panel.

/DEV8008/STATS/CMDSTREAM/PACKETSRECEIVED.Description: Number of packets received on the command stream from the device since session start.

/DEV8008/AWGS/2/SINGLE.Description: Puts the AWG into single shot mode.

/DEV8008/AWGS/0/AUXTRIGGERS/1/STATE.Description: State of the Auxiliary Trigger: No trigger detected/trigger detected.

/DEV8008/SYSTEM/CALIB/AUTO.Description: Enables an automatic instrument self calibration about 16 min after start up. In order to guarantee the full specification, it is recommended to perform a self calibration after warm-up of the device.

/DEV8008/SIGOUTS/5/ENABLES/1.Description: Enables individual output signal amplitude. When the MD option is used, it is possible to generate signals being the linear combination of the available demodulator frequencies.

/DEV8008/AWGS/0/ELF/CHECKSUM.Description: Checksum of the uploaded ELF file.

/DEV8008/SYSTEM/FWLOGENABLE.Description: Enables logging to the fwlog node.

/DEV8008/AWGS/1/OUTPUTS/0/MODE.Description: Select between direct mode and amplitude modulation mode.

/DEV8008/SIGOUTS/5/ON.Description: Enabling/Disabling the Signal Output. Corresponds to the blue LED indicator on the instrument front panel.

/DEV8008/AWGS/1/USERREGS/1.Description: Integer user register value. The sequencer has reading and writing access to the user register values during run time.

/DEV8008/SIGOUTS/1/ON.Description: Enabling/Disabling the Signal Output. Corresponds to the blue LED indicator on the instrument front panel.

/DEV8008/AWGS/0/OUTPUTS/0/ENABLES/1.Description: Enables the driving of the given AWG output channel.

/DEV8008/TRIGGERS/IN/6/IMP50.Description: Trigger input impedance: When on, the trigger input impedance is 50 Ohm, when off 1 k Ohm.

/DEV8008/AWGS/3/SEQUENCER/STATUS.Description: Status of the sequencer on the instrument.

/DEV8008/AWGS/0/USERREGS/10.Description: Integer user register value. The sequencer has reading and writing access to the user register values during run time.

/DEV8008/AWGS/2/USERREGS/12.Description: Integer user register value. The sequencer has reading and writing access to the user register values during run time.

/DEV8008/SYSTEM/CALIB/TIMEINTERVAL.Description: Time interval for which the self calibration is valid. After this time it is recommended to rerun the auto calibration.

/DEV8008/AWGS/2/WAVEFORM/DESCRIPTORS.Description: Displays various properties of the current waveform: name, filename, function, channels, length, segment, hash.

/DEV8008/AWGS/3/SWEEP/AWGTRIGS/0.Description: Node used by the sweeper module for fast index sweeps. When selected as sweep grid the sweeper module will switch into a fast index based scan mode. This mode can be up to 1000 times faster than conventional node sweeps. The sequencer program must support this functionality. See section 'AWG Index Sweep' of the UHF user manual for more information.

/DEV8008/AWGS/1/USERREGS/3.Description: Integer user register value. The sequencer has reading and writing access to the user register values during run time.

/DEV8008/TRIGGERS/IN/4/IMP50.Description: Trigger input impedance: When on, the trigger input impedance is 50 Ohm, when off 1 k Ohm.

/DEV8008/SYSTEM/CALIB/CALIBRATE.Description: Initiates self calibration to improve input digitizer linearity.

/DEV8008/AWGS/2/USERREGS/2.Description: Integer user register value. The sequencer has reading and writing access to the user register values during run time.

/DEV8008/STATS/CMDSTREAM/PENDING.Description: Number of buffers ready for receiving command packets from the device.

/DEV8008/AWGS/1/SEQUENCER/PROGRAM.Description: Displays the source code of the current sequence program.

/DEV8008/SIGOUTS/3/ENABLES/0.Description: Enables individual output signal amplitude. When the MD option is used, it is possible to generate signals being the linear combination of the available demodulator frequencies.

/DEV8008/AWGS/2/USERREGS/10.Description: Integer user register value. The sequencer has reading and writing access to the user register values during run time.

/DEV8008/AWGS/3/SEQUENCER/ASSEMBLY.Description: Displays the current sequence program in compiled form. Every line corresponds to one hardware instruction and requires one clock cycle (4.44 ns) for execution.

/DEV8008/AWGS/1/WAVEFORM/DESCRIPTORS.Description: Displays various properties of the current waveform: name, filename, function, channels, length, segment, hash.

/DEV8008/AWGS/0/SWEEP/AWGTRIGS/0.Description: Node used by the sweeper module for fast index sweeps. When selected as sweep grid the sweeper module will switch into a fast index based scan mode. This mode can be up to 1000 times faster than conventional node sweeps. The sequencer program must support this functionality. See section 'AWG Index Sweep' of the UHF user manual for more information.

/DEV8008/STATUS/ADC0MIN.Description: The minimum value on Signal Input 1 (ADC0) during 100 ms

/DEV8008/STATUS/ADC0MAX.Description: The maximum value on Signal Input 1 (ADC0) during 100 ms.

/DEV8008/SYSTEM/OWNER.Description: Returns the current owner of the device (IP).

/DEV8008/AWGS/2/SEQUENCER/MEMORYUSAGE.Description: Size of the current sequence program relative to the device cache memory. The cache memory provides space for 1024 instructions. Memory Usage over 100% means that instructions must be loaded from the main memory during playback, which can lead to delays.

/DEV8008/AWGS/2/ELF/NAME.Description: The name of the uploaded ELF file.

/DEV8008/AWGS/0/OUTPUTS/0/AMPLITUDE.Description: Amplitude in units of full scale of the given AWG Output. The full scale corresponds to the Range voltage setting of the Signal Outputs.

/DEV8008/AWGS/0/USERREGS/0.Description: Integer user register value. The sequencer has reading and writing access to the user register values during run time.

/DEV8008/AWGS/1/SINGLE.Description: Puts the AWG into single shot mode.

/DEV8008/SIGOUTS/7/AMPLITUDES/0.Description: Sets the peak amplitude that the oscillator assigned to the given demodulation channel contributes to the signal output.

/DEV8008/AWGS/3/AUXTRIGGERS/1/STATE.Description: State of the Auxiliary Trigger: No trigger detected/trigger detected.

/DEV8008/SIGOUTS/5/AMPLITUDES/1.Description: Sets the peak amplitude that the oscillator assigned to the given demodulation channel contributes to the signal output.

/DEV8008/STATUS/ADC1MAX.Description: The maximum value on Signal Input 2 (ADC1) during 100 ms.

/DEV8008/AWGS/0/WAVEFORM/MEMORYUSAGE.Description: Amount of the used waveform data relative to the device cache memory. The cache memory provides space for 32 kSa of waveform data. Memory Usage over 100% means that waveforms must be loaded from the main memory (128 MSa per channel) during playback, which can lead to delays.

This mode can be up to 1000 times faster than conventional node sweeps. The sequencer program must support this functionality. Options.0: Device is warmed-up and self calibrated.
Options.1: It is recommended to manually execute a self calibration to assure operation according to specifications.
Options.2: Device is warming up and will automatically execute a self calibration after 16 minutes.

This mode can be up to 1000 times faster than conventional node sweeps. The sequencer program must support this functionality. See section 'AWG Index Sweep' of the UHF user manual for more information.

/DEV8008/SYSTEM/JUMBO.Description: Enables jumbo frames (4k) on the TCP/IP interface. This will reduce the load on the PC and is required to achieve maximal throughput. Make sure that jumbo frames (4k) are enabled on the network card as well. If one of the devices on the network is not able to work with jumbo frames, the connection will fail.

/DEV8008/STATS/DATASTREAM/PACKETSLOST.Description: Number of data packets lost since device start. Data packets contain measurement data.

/DEV8008/AWGS/2/USERREGS/8.Description: Integer user register value. The sequencer has reading and writing access to the user register values during run time.

/DEV8008/STATUS/FLAGS/BINARY.Description: A set of binary flags giving an indication of the state of various parts of the device. Bit 0: Signal Input 1 overflow, Bit 1: Signal Input 2 overflow (MFLI Current Input 1), Bit 2: Analog PLL fail, Bit 3: Output 1 DAC OK, Bit 4: Output 2 DAC OK, Bit 5: Signal Output 1 clipping, Bit 6: Signal Output 2 clipping, Bit 7: Ext Ref 1 Locked, Bit 8: Ext Ref 2 Locked, Bit 9:Ext Ref 3 Locked, Bit 10:Ext Ref 4 Locked, Bit 11: Sample Loss, Bits 12 - 13: Trigger In 1, Bits 14 - 15: Trigger In 2, Bits 16 - 17: Trigger In 3, Bits 18 - 19: Trigger In 4, Bit 20: PLL 1 locked, Bit 21: PLL 2 locked, Bit 22: PLL 3 locked, Bit 23: PLL 4 locked, Bit 24: Rubidium clock locked, Bit 25: AU Cartesian 1 Overflow, Bit 26: AU Cartesian 2 Overflow, Bit 27: AU Polar 1 Overflow, Bit 28: AU Polar 2 Overflow.

/DEV8008/AWGS/0/USERREGS/9.Description: Integer user register value. The sequencer has reading and writing access to the user register values during run time.

/DEV8008/AWGS/0/SEQUENCER/MEMORYUSAGE.Description: Size of the current sequence program relative to the device cache memory. The cache memory provides space for 1024 instructions. Memory Usage over 100% means that instructions must be loaded from the main memory during playback, which can lead to delays.

/DEV8008/AWGS/3/USERREGS/14.Description: Integer user register value. The sequencer has reading and writing access to the user register values during run time.

/DEV8008/AWGS/3/SWEEP/AWGTRIGS/3.Description: Node used by the sweeper module for fast index sweeps. When selected as sweep grid the sweeper module will switch into a fast index based scan mode. This mode can be up to 1000 times faster than conventional node sweeps. The sequencer program must support this functionality. See section 'AWG Index Sweep' of the UHF user manual for more information.

/DEV8008/TRIGGERS/IN/7/LEVEL.Description: Trigger voltage level at which the trigger input toggles between low and high. Use 50% amplitude for digital input and consider the trigger hysteresis.

/DEV8008/SIGOUTS/0/AMPLITUDES/0.Description: Sets the peak amplitude that the oscillator assigned to the given demodulation channel contributes to the signal output.

/DEV8008/TRIGGERS/IN/6/LEVEL.Description: Trigger voltage level at which the trigger input toggles between low and high. Use 50% amplitude for digital input and consider the trigger hysteresis.

Options.1: Modulation: AWG Output 1 (2) is multiplied with oscillator signal of demodulator 4 (8).
